Summary: very good darjeeling for the money
Text:
Very happy with this tea. Light, pleasant, NOT bitter.

To those compaining about the particle size; if you strain it after it is brewed, many more particles will be removed AFTER the tea swells from rehydration. If you are then somehow offended by the few particles remaining, filter it.

To those compaining about bitterness; I wonder if they know how to properly brew a cup of fine tea. Do NOT use boiling water. Use water heated only to 180 degrees, or allow to cool first to 180. Water much hotter than that will bring bitterness from tannin release. That is true for most teas. Buy a thermometer.

I steep mine for 3 to 4 minutes in 180 to 185 degree water, then strain, then reheat the strained tea to serving temperature. Very good without sweetener.

ProfileName: Doreen B. Bishop "Doreen Bishop cat parent"
Summary: A BIG YUMMMM TO AMAZON FOR SELLING SEES
Text: I grew up eating this wonderful candy, in my book there is no better. A bit pricey but well worth it. When I eat Sees Truffles my tummy giggles :-) Thanks Amazon for making this product available. You are my one stop shop these days. Fantastic candy fast delivery

These literally made me sick.  First, when you open the package you have to drain off the water, which is fine except that once you do the whole thing has the faint scent of fish.  I guess that's not so bad if you like fish, but I don't. (2) Then you have to put them in a pan full of water and boil them for about 1 minute.  What you come up with are these small little pearls that essentially smell fishy and taste like nothing at all unless maybe its pearls of tasteless rubber.  I tried butter and salt, the flavoring from ramen noodles, spaghetti sauce, velveeta for mac and cheese.  Nothing made the consistency of these little pearls any better.  In essence it feels like you are taking a mouthful of big metamucil (which makes me gag anyway).  But beyond that, after I ate the smallest amount of them, they made my stomach cramp and I was nauseated for the rest of the evening.  At first I thought it was just a quirky thing, but I tried something else on them to see if it made them better and I got even sicker.  At that point I was done.  Yeuck.  A waste of money.  I'm going to try the kind mixed with tofu and if they stink as bad as these, or make me sick then I'm done, if I don't end up in the hospital with some gastric illness.

I was afraid to try this flavor but I was surprised, they are pretty good. I put these in my healthy vending machines and they sell.
[...].

The fantastic flavor of this coconut oil has made it a regular staple in my cooking, frequently (if not usually) replacing both butter and canola oil. It's even a great butter-replacement for bread! My only regret is that I didn't buy a larger tub; it's going fast!

No need to fret healthy eaters!!! These taste so fresh, they're FANTASTIC and with rice products, you MUST eat Organic! Too many GMO's in regular rice...not cool!

These make the best instant belly-fillers. Sooo glad they're sold on Amazon! Yay!

I first tasted and loved Lavazza espresso during time in Italy, where it's popularly consumed. The rich aroma and full flavor are a delight, and I don't find it overly acidic (it's certainly MUCH easier on my stomach than American-style drip coffee, and this from someone with strong stomach and a love of all kinds of drip coffees). I haven't tasted the various Lavazza roasts extensively, but I typically buy and adore Crema e Gusto--in fact, I brew it *every* single morning I'm at home and drink it latte-style, at about a 2:1 warmed-milk to hot-espresso ratio.

I heartily recommend buying an authentic Italian stovetop coffeemaker to brew this espresso. I have and love the Bialetti six-cup caffettiere (Bialetti 6800 Moka Express 6-Cup Stovetop Espresso Maker, found here on Amazon). It's what the typical Italian family uses every morning and throughout the day.

The Lavazza vacuum packs are sturdy and small little bricks that store easily, and every time I snip open a new container the distinctive, warm aroma rush fills my kitchen. Mmmm, Lavazza.

My kids (18 mo and 3 yrs) love the HappyBaby Tots.  We have tried every flavor and they eat all of them.  I love that they are getting good, organic nutrition, and that the ingredients are wholesome.  They are very convenient to throw in your diaper bag or purse on-the-go, or to stick in a lunch box for a snack.  We use a spoon and sometimes a bowl at home for self feeding with my little one, but you can also give the pouch to them to eat directly from the squeeze pouch.  Thank you, HappyBaby, for such great products!!

Summary: Not Heinz mayonnaise. Not the item pictured.
Text:
I got a box full of mayonnaise packets, and there likely are about 200 in there (I'm not going to count them) but they are NOT the Heinz mayonnaise packets pictured. They are a generic 'Mayonnaise' packet (blue lettering on white background) - the same kind I used to have in my office's break room in the early 1990s. I don't doubt they'll taste fine as far as mayonnaise goes, but it's not what is advertised.

Another issue is that there are no expiration dates, either on the box or the packets themselves. This would be helpful information to have as we are storing these for use with canned chicken and tuna for emergency food storage. There is only a production date, so I will have to use my own judgement on how long mayo is likely good after being produced!

Summary: Better than Most of the Other So-Called "Bold" K-Cups!!
Text:
As one of the previous reviewers said, this is the first "K-cup" that doesn't taste at least somewhat watery. I've tried LOTS of the Green Mountain sanctioned "extra bold" varieties (Jet Fuel, Dark Magic, Black Tiger, Double Black Diamond, etc.), but the new "RealCup" Martinson Dark Roast is in a class by itself. Not necessarily a better "flavor" than the others mind you, but definitely more full-bodied and robust....not to mention significantly less expensive!

BTW, absolutely no "sludge" or "dust" to be found at the bottom (or anywhere else) in my mug. Only a good, satisfying cup of Joe! Highly recommended!

Next, I plan to try a few of the Brown Gold RealCup varieties. Look for even more choices to hit the market as some of the Green Mountain K-cup patents expire.

This is my favorite soup!! I don't know why we can't find it in the stores anymore. I'm so glad I found it at Amazon!! We've already gone through the 12 cans we purchased.  Guess I'll have to order 2 cases next time.  As always, Amazon shipped it really quick.

This espresso tea is wonderfully aromatic, reminds me of cherry tobacco, but does not transfer well to the palate, or at least mine.  The scent is very strong as you are sipping the tea, and it overwhelms me, but I have a keen sense of smell so that may not be a problem for others.  It is hard to differentiate the actual taste from the scent.  I don't think I will try it again.

Venison - Meat (min. 50%), Liver, Tripe, Heart and Kidney (min. 19.5%), Fish (min. 15%), Chicory Inulin, Green-lipped Mussel (min. 4%), Fish Oil, Lecithin, Kelp, Vitamins and Minerals, Parsley, Naturally preserved with mixed tocopherols, Additives: Vit. Summary: Happy with San Francisco Bay OneCup French Roast
Text: I am so happy with this new economical and more environmentally friendly coffee.  The flavor and aroma are just what I expect from a French Roast -- deep and bold. I keep the pods in a ziplock bag in the refrigerator. My husband and I each drink at least two cups every morning, so we go through a box pretty quickly with no concerns about the coffee pods staying fresh. After much anticipation I ordered the three main Jamon Ham products: Iberico de Bellota, Iberico de Bellota Paleta, & Jamon Serrano.

Being used to Proscuitto (Parma) and loving it by itself and in many dishes, I had high expectations. If you haven't had good proscuitto, then there isn't really anything to compare the Jamon product to. The chopped stuff at your everyday grocery store is good for a little salty proscuitto like flavor in dishes but not for slices just to enjoy.

I understand why people think Jamon is awesome, but the melting in your mouth with extreme grease/fat over your lips and fingers really sets home the fat content more than that Kobe Beef flavor burst and easier swallow.

In the high end Jamon, you can really taste the acorns in the meat. The nuttiness really comes through and it is very good. The Iberico Paleta -> you don't get the nuttiness and it's a little tougher. The Serrano really has much more meat and I preferred the flavor profile on it more than the other two.

While I would rate the Iberico Bellato around 4 out of 5 stars (minus 1 for the heavy greasy feeling and fat), the price is ridiculous. I would say it would be appropriately priced around $15-25/pound. Given that is 4-6x lower than it's actual price, I had to take at least 2 stars from the product.

You're better off with the SM Proscuitto. It's delicious and you get 4x the amount without the heavy grease.
SO GOOD SO PERFECT SO TENDER SO MEATY SO TASTY SO DELICIOUS YOU WILL NOT BE ABLE TO EAT JUST ONE, BELIEVE ME I HAVE TRIED. ALL CAPS IS RUDE.

This is a nice item -- chunks of meat, good gravy. My cat is not fond of all the varieties, but it is a nice little treat nonetheless.

But I do think this item is a bit pricy ... about $1 per 3-ounce can.
For licorice lovers only.  Intense licorice flavor and is naturally sweet, so needs no sugar or honey.  Drinking a cup is like eating licorice for dessert, without the calories.

Summary: Colored water would taste more like coffee than this stuff!
Text: I don't know what Emeril means by Jazzed Up, but this has no coffee flavor at all. You may as well be drinking water. Save your money.

First, let me say that I am very happy that this manufacture is trying to create a healthier product and is also trying to package their product using a lot of recyclable or sustainable materials. These points alone encourage me to consider this product over dominate corporate graham cracker manufactures that has lost their way.

Each individual box contains three packets of graham crackers containing 7 crackers each (21 total crackers per box). Oddly enough, I couldn't find any mention of this on the packaging.

The taste I find just average and bit on the dry side. Make sure you have something to wash them down with, but that's true of most graham crackers. I'm not sure what they could do to make it taste better as I've never made graham crackers myself. The added oats are a nice touch but since they are sprinkled on the top they often fall off as you pull them out of the packaging. I wonder why they didn't just mix the oats in the batter? I've also tried the apple cinnamon flavor and would rate the taste a bit more satisfying than the honey flavor.

All in all, I do recommend these crackers despite the 3/5 rating but namely for the healthier ingredients. And for the record, I do not think I've ever had a 5/5 graham cracker. :)

PROS
====
+ Healthy core ingredients compared to many competitors. For example, normal sugar instead of corn syrup and sea salt (extra minerals) instead of standard salt
+ No artificial colors or preservatives
+ Pro environment packaging

CONS
====
- Vast majority of crackers broken
- Oats easily fall off crackers
- Taste is average (also a tad dry and slightly rough on the mouth compared Nabisco)
- Inconsistent or inadequate perforations making it hard to break crackers in half or fourths

Summary: Great with FULL FAT coconut milk
Text: We love this Panang Curry.  It takes about 5 minutes to make and then we just pour it over chicken, veggies and rice.  We've tried it with low fat coconut milk and it just doesn't thicken up enough.  I definitely recommend getting the regular coconut milk and then just steaming your veggies instead of stir frying.  Enjoy!
I absolutely love the new bold Salt & Vinegar almonds by Blue Diamond! It just doesn't get any better than this!

I am very pleased with this dog food. My sheltie has a good coat and good movements with Harmony Farms. Does much better with this food than others. He is a very picky eater, so I do add chicken and he will eat. We will stick with Harmony Farms. I also like the bag, it helps keep the food fresh.

Summary: Looks and smells gross, but my baby wouldn't stop eating it!
Text: Our pediatrician recommended this flavor combination when we first started solids because it has 120% of daily iron needs.  Well, when I sat down to feed it to my baby, all I could was, wow, this is so gross!  It looks pretty much the same way going in as it does coming out, if you know what I mean.  To my surprise, my picky eater gobbled it up!  She ate more of this than any other baby food flavor we had offered.  A 2-3oz package of anything else was lasting two days, but she ate almost the whole 3.5oz package of this in one sitting.  I did taste it, and the apples make it sweet and appetizing (and I really do not like spinach).  We've had more success with Ella's Kitchen than any other brand, but this flavor especially has been great.  Looks gross, smells gross, sounds gross, but I say, give it a try.
I have no problem with the shipping.  However, my cats don't like this litter.  I have mixed it with one they like better and I am hoping that things will get better.

Tastes like a rancid dishrag pickled in brine.  No sign of spoilage - just bad tasting.  I bought based on the rave reviews of others here so I thought I'd chime in with my opinion.  I'm comparing this with the Fresh and Easy house brand - scarcely the premium - that costs less and is scrumptious.

Yes you may need to take a second mortgage out to afford this dog food but it is the first dog food that my dog is not allergic too. So far so good as he doesn't itch anymore or bite his paws.
Just wish Amazon had free shipping and a subcription available, that could drive down the cost!
If you like a cup of coffee available for you anytime, then these are perfect.  One envelope makes the perfect cup of coffee.  Easy to take anywhere. GREAT for traveling!

Summary: Organix Adult Indoor Feline Dry Cat Food
Text: I found this type of cat food to be excellent for my cat's health and weight.  She was a bit overweight and it helped bring it under control.  Although I did find that she didn't like it as much as her old dry cat food because it didn't have as much flavor.
This product is a great value.  It not only tastes great, but the price was substantailly less than their competitors.

Twinings Earl Grey is my favorite tea, and I drink it almost daily.  I've tried Bigelow, Harrods, etc. and I like Twinings best, either loose or in bags, so I know exactly what this tea is supposed to taste like.  I was a bit concerned that the K-cups would disappoint, but I was pleasantly surprised.  I tried the 3 smallest brew sizes before I found a trick that works for me.  I double-brew one K-cup on the smallest setting.  By this I mean that I run the water through 1 K-cup twice, both times on the smallest size which makes a large cup that for me is about the right strength and flavor.  When you factor in the convenience and speed of using the Keurig, this makes getting a good cup of tea a breeze.

This product arrived and I found it a little odd that a liquid food product such as this is not encased in a cellophane shrink wrapping.  Then I opened the top and found that there was not even a seal across the top of the bottle.  I promptly threw the stuff out!

Summary: Some of the best crackers made
Text: Carr's crackers are about as good as crackers get.  They're tasty, sized right and sturdy enough for dipping.

These are good but the flavor did not resemble an oreo. I purchased these along with the chips ahoy and those did resemble the flavor of chips ahoy. In my opinion these tasted like animal crackers. I will stick to chips ahoy 100 calorie packs.
This is a very simple, soothing chamomile. A touch of honey makes this tea wonderful. And who doesn't love the little affirmations on the tea bag tags?

I've really enjoyed this K-cup. The coffee is strong and flavorful and I love that the Cups are recyclable. After I open the package, I put the remaining K-cups in a container in the refrigerator to help keep them fresh.

My dog is used to MilkBones... she clearly likes these way better. They must even smell great, because she is not usually entirely attentive for the "sit" to get her treat, and I had her full attention with these from the get go.

OTOH, she always likes anything "new", so the real test will be whether she likes them in a few months. But they are a big hit right now!
I use this in my protein shakes. I combine this with maca, hemp protein, cacao, and fresh or frozen fruit and it is great.
I am very pleased with my purchase of Caffe Verona.  It is a robust coffee with just the right flavor and aroma!

Summary: Doesn't taste at all like cotton Candy
Text: I love cotton candy and was excited to try this, but it doesn't tast anything like cotton candy.  It had a strong chemical smell with a taste that I really don't know how to describe.  I used it with funfetti cake mix and while the taste was fine, it wasn't anything like what I expected.
We have tried all of the Hazelnut flavored coffee brands.  This is by far the best.  To bad it isn't an auto ship.

This is so great tasting. I used it to make macaroni salad and mac and cheese and both came out great. It does soak up liquid more so use extra. When I made the macaroni salad I had to add more mayonnaise twice while it was chilling. Leftover mac and cheese after a few hours was a little dry, but still tasted good. My non gf husband said it was the best mac and cheese he's had, and he also enjoyed the macaroni salad. He never likes whole wheat items so for him to like this says something about it. I also love that I can buy it in the grocery store instead of having to order it online. Tinkyada knows their (gluten free) stuff!

I am always looking for healthy, low calorie snacks, so when I heard about Popchips, I was intrigued. They are crunchy chips that are not fried, and not baked, but created using heat and pressure to make them pop into being. Since I love sweet potato chips in general, I thought I would give these a try.

The first thing I noticed was the color. They looked a bit lighter in color to other sweet potato chips I have tried, and I think this is due to them not being fried. They really looked the same color as fresh, cooked sweet potatoes. I did not notice any particular smell, other than good old sweet potatoes. So far so good.

In terms of taste, I thought they tasted great. The chips were nice and crispy, with only a hint of salt, so you really got to enjoy the naturally sweet flavor. I can really see that these will help satisfy cravings for something crunchy, something salty, something sweet, and especially something that is all three.

The texture is definitely not that of a typical potato chip. They are lighter, crisper, and airy, not as dense as a rice cake, but not as greasy as a typical chip. All in all, I was really pleased with them. Someone looking for a healthy replacement, or enjoys other veggie chip type snacks would really like these, I think. For a die hard chip lover, these would might not satisfy you upon first taste, but give them a couple of chances; personally I loved them.

With the snack size bag being 100 calories, I am pretty sold on these as a healthy snack alternative. This would be a great addition to a sandwich for lunch, or an in-between meal snack. I am happy to add Popchips to my snack rotation.

Summary: Very hot, but you are guaranteed heartburn
Text: If you want the hottest chip available, its right here.  Taste is pretty good, but it is overwhelmed by the heat.  If you eat more than a few chips, you are pretty much guaranteed heartburn.  This stuff is wicked.  Only for the people that really love spicy foods.

I originally bought Timothy's camomile tea and really liked it, but the price has doubled since then. I found this to be a great bargain and is just as good. I stocked up on it as the k cup prices seem to be getting out of control now.
Strawberry Kiwi is an outstanding diet drink mix.  A good way to get your water intake.

My favorite uncle is diabetic, and I always feel awful when I invite him for my birthday and he can't join in on eating cake with the rest of us. I picked up a package of these and used them for a cookie crust on a cream pie with Jell-O Sugar-Free Instant Pudding & Pie Filling, Chocolate, 1.4-Ounce Boxes (Pack of 24) and whipped cream lightly sweetened with non-sugar sweetener. The result was gorgeous and tasted pretty good even to those of us who can have sugar. For him? He told me "You know I can't have sugar." and when I told him it was sugar free he dug in with gusto. He said "It's not even my birthday and I feel like I got the best present."
It was so easy to make, and the crust was his favorite part. I gave him an extra package of cookies I bought and he enjoyed those a lot too.
Love these for making it so much easier to make special treats for my uncle.

Summary: None of the five cats will eat it
Text:
I looked closley to see what the stars meant with one meaning "I hate it." I. personally, do not eat it, but none of my 6 kitties,including 2 ferals (last time I wrote, I had only one feral, but now have two and neither feral will eat this. They may be wild and not let a human close to them, but they know their cat food tastes. Two stars means "I don't like it, and since I am the one doing the buying, I figure it is OK if I state that that "I don'tlike it" because I do not like buying something that the 6 cats that I feed will not eat it. I feed the ferals outside the back door and I can watch them "eat or not eat" by watching through the window. My kitties always announce the arrival of the ferals by jumping up and down at the window when my regular "orange and white kitty" and my "sometimes I deign to eat here 'black and white Kitty'" arrive for dinner! My, My, What an exciting life I have!!!...The high point of my evening being watching the ferals eat and then writing a review of their eating habits up on Amazon!
Anyway, I have made it clear as to how I keep tabs of the ferals and their eating habits. The inside kitties are pretty easy to manage. When trying a new variety of food (new to us) I just put that bowl in the kitchen where "the special eating" bowls go. Dry food and water are in the kitchen and whatever "speciality of the evening" is also located there. No, they do not get a new flavor every night! But one bowl goes there so they always go "aLookin" in the kitchen area for their night's extra bowl of wet food! Spoiled??? Yes!!!! Then I know if it is eaten or not. The specialty bowl gets 3 nights of trial...not in a row...to avoid "nose sticker uppers." But kitties know a wet bowl is always placed alongside the water and the dry in the kitchen. Water and dry are also located elsewhere, but the kitchen ONLY gets the wet nightly special got trial/accuracy purposes. Nothing is TOO much for the trial and accuracy information for Amazon!
It has been 3 weeks now with the Newman Chicken and Brown Rice. There is no question. None of my cats eat it. Not even the birds seem to care for it...or any other animal...as the birds generally eat the dried out left overs and if the bowl is chewed to death, it means a coyote has been by, but I haven't had any coyotes all winter.(Somebody is putting out vittles more to their liking somewhere else, or they have gone further south this winter.
So, there, my friends, is how I ended up at this choice of stars for Chicken and Brown Rice Rice Formula Newman's Own. Oddly enough, everyone likes the beef and brown rice:Newman's Own Organics Adult Variety Pack Canned Cat Food, but that is a whole "nother" story for a different time.
Sorry that we have a disappointing story to tell: Gabby, Trinity, Wisdom, Mercy, Orange and White Kitty and Black and White Kitty...as told to and documented by "Cindy O". Bye for now on the cat food trail tale until we "come upon" something else good ole mom thinks should be tried.

I paid an outrageous price ($1.49) for this product at a pet store.  It is made far too rigidly to work on the smallest size cans.  Once it is on the can, it is impossible for me to remove.  I enlisted my husband's help and even he has trouble getting it off.  I was given a FREE can cover at another pet store.  It is a softer plastic and works much better.  If you use the smallest size cans, forget about this one!

This is one of my favorite mixes for the holidays.
Brings that festive feeling to life as you make it, serve it and drink it.
It's one of my favorite treats as well as my family's.

I have gotten this flavor of slim jim before from amazon and loved it however this order tasted like salty cardboard! Expiration date of march 08 but these must have been stored improperly because they are nasty. I guess with amazon your rolling the dice when you order snacks. Sometimes they are good and sometimes they really really bad. Good luck to all who are brave enough to gamble their $$$

This has been my favorite candy for the last 30 years.  I used to be able to find it in local stores, but now I have to order it online.  The best price I found anywhere was here on Amazon, and the shipping was super fast.  The package arrived only 3 days after my purchase.

Kind fruit and nut bars are a great snack for between last break (1:30) and supper.I only eat half, it is high in calories.I eat it with some plain yogert for lunch to balance out the sweetness in the Kind bar. The price is better online then in stores, and alot better then a candy bar from the vending machine at work.

I use all these More Than Gourmet sauces as a base for our dinners. Saute chicken breast or boneless thighs (or in the case of the beef sauce a steak, or shrimp in the case of the seafood MTG base) and when done remove from pan and add some chopped shallot or onion and garlic and saute a bit, add a half cup of wine and about a tablespoon of the MTG base and simmer to reduce a bit, Remove from the heat and add a tablespoon of cold butter and stir into the sauce until it melts, serve over the sauteed chicken, voila, instant gourmet dinner in about 10 minutes.
I have been eating this specific  type of food for two years, now. I find it much cheaper to purchase through Amazon and I am happy to be on auto-delivery with this product.
This hot chocolate leaves a lot to be desired. The flavor seems to be left out of the can!!

My kids LOOOOOVE these!! Especially my 3 year old who is pretty severely autistic. It gives him great oral sensory input since they are so chewy! We don't have them in our stores anymore so I'm glad we can get them here! They aree made mostly from fruit, not corn syrup like most of the other types of fruit sticks. They are a little sticky but that's why they come in the wrapper, you just move it down enough to take a bite. I highly recommend!

I had been using Muir Glen Organic whole/diced tomatoes, but after having had cancer I read a lot of research publications indicating that BPA's estrogen mimicking effects can be quite dangerous. BPA found in cans with acidic foods are some of the worst since the chemical is leached out even more. The same is true of plastic containers with BPA -- acid, heat or surface abrasion lead to much greater leaching into the food.

Although Muir Glen is promising to get rid of BPA in their can liners, they are replacing it with some unspecified 'vinyl-based substitute'. If you want to get their cans without BPA, look for a use-by date of around the summer of 2013. [This info is per a conversation with their customer service representative.]

I had heard about Pomi Tetra-pak products before -- Mario Batali and other foodies/chefs have recommended them so I thought I would give them a try.

The tomatoes are naturally grown in Italy without pesticides and have no salt added. I used them to create a wonderful marinara sauce. They taste great and I am very happy with the quality.
this a great product because you can have all your olives, caper berries,and red peppers all in one location. wonderful flavor and beautiful display.

Summary: Excellent Scoop. Well Worth The Money.
Text:
I bought three of these Van Ness Cat Litter Scoops at Wal-Mart about five years ago. I got excellent service out of them. I use the "clumping" cat litter and I tend to be somewhat negligent in cleaning the litter box. As such, a lot of the clumps can be stuck together. I've broken a couple of the scoops in attempting to break them apart. It's not the scoop's fault. It's my fault. Or maybe we could say that it's the litter's fault in that it has such a good odor control that I don't even notice the box needs freshening.

Ah well, I paid less than a dollar each for these things at the time and they've lasted all these years, I'd say it was an excellent product well worth the money. I now bought a new one of a different brand and I hope it works as well. So far it has.

Gary Peterson

Summary: Outstanding quality gourmet assorted Italian cookies
Text: Over the holidays in December 2011, I purchased this product for two individuals and had the cookies delivered to both friends at their homes.  The cookies arrived fresh and in excellent condition and were enjoyed by both individuals with them both telling me they enjoyed the cookies very much.  I would definitely buy this product again and not hesitate to order from this supplier for delivery anywhere.  This is a company I have complete confidence in to provide a good quality product upon delivery and who cares about their customers.  Will order again.  Thank you.

Summary: INFO ABOUT RECALL- and my personal review at the end
Text:
March 1, 2011

Vet Med received notification today from WellPetÂ® LLC., the parent company for WELLNESSÂ® Pet Foods, that specific lots of WELLNESSÂ® canned cat foods, purchased from our store, should be returned to us immediately for replacement.

The company has reassured us that there is no immediate threat to the health of our customer's beloved pets, however, recent testing has indicated that specific lots might contain less than adequate levels of thiamine (also known as Vitamin B1).

Cats fed only these products over time could be at risk for developing thiamine deficiency. Although the risk for thiamine deficiency is remote, the company is taking the extra precaution of voluntarily removing these products from store shelves and asking customers to return any of the affected lots. The company has also taken additional steps in their manufacturing process to ensure that this does not happen again.

-------------------------------------------------------------------------------

I have been feeding Wellness for years. My ten year old is in optimal health. She's never had a surgery other than her spay, and has only been on antibiotics a couple times. She's been fed Wellness since I received her.

Wow who would have thought of this! I bought this for our 10 year old grandson who was visiting and it was a hit! We perfer to use it in waffles. They are nice and crispy and taste like desert! I think they would be good for a desert if you added strawberries and whipped cream and a touch of cinnamon. We have served them to all our company and they are a big hit! Not a lot of chocolate chips just enough to taste the chocolate. Nice for a change of pace. I will order more for sure.

I knew these Cachou Lajaunie since my days in Paris.  I'm so glad that I was able to find them here. These tiny licorice squares pack a real punch. Not too sweet and perfect for those who like licorice candy with the added benefit of negligible calories.

I used as a flavor enhancer (not as a 'TREAT") for our kidney failure cat and found it to be among the best.  See my separate review of CAT-MAN-DO BONITO SPRINKLES for  a summary of my experiences with over four dozen products I tried to enhance the appetite of our CRF/CKD mom-cat. I have no reason to suspect that this product would be any less effective as a treat.

Summary: Ingredients not listed on product description
Text: Earth's Best and in particular, the sweet potato cinnamon and pumpkin apple varieties of this Seasonal Harvest line (which we have purchased elsewhere before), are brilliant and have really appealed to my picky eater but ... a note of concern and the reason I am writing a review for the first time, and only giving 3 stars, is because the apple turkey cranberry dinner contains WHEAT, which is disclosed on the jar once you purchase, receive and open the package, and the green bean casserole contains ONION, again only listed on the jar and not something every baby can tolerate.  Unfortunately that means we can only eat half of this pack, which doesn't make it very cost effective.  Otherwise, really good food.

The dogs loved them.  I was looking for something that would last a long time and be good for them other than play toys they tend to eat.  These went pretty fast for the money I paid for them.  Would like something that is good for them and close to indestructible and also keeps them entertained for a long time.

I have 2 cats and they are basically addicted to this stuff.  The minute I so much as pick up the bag they come running from whereever they are.  Even if you just say "yellow bag" the little ears perk up and they are ready to pounce.  Don't have any idea what makes them so irresistable but they obviously are.  I know other people who have had the same experience with their cats.  Too bad chocolate doesn't have 2 calories per piece like this does.

Greenies are the house crowd pleaser...my westie, who is NOT food oriented, will pull out every trick in her repertoire before I can ask to get one of these. My lab starts to drool when he sees one. My shihvanese practically does back flips! Everyone loves greenies. I like how they leave my dogs' breath sweet smelling and teeth clean. Easily digestible, senior formulas with joint help, great on their digestive system, just a great, great product! Can't recommend it enough.

I will say though...if your dog is a gulper, please make sure you watch them while they eat/chew. They seem to like it so much that you really need to be on hand just in case, as is true with any chewy product for your furkids!

Kind bars are GOOD.  I'm a hiker and it's tough to hike in food that is both lightweight and tasty.  Kind Bars are the best I've found.  No more powerbars for me.  They are full of natural ingredients - you can see them all.  About 170 calories per bar (average).  Some of my favorite flavors are Chocolate Cherry Cashew and Cranberry Almond, but there's not a "bad" flavor.  I keep these at work for that mid-morning snack and in the car all the time.
Always consistently good.  High quality salt.  My primary choice for over ten years.  Have compared to others and it always wins...hands-down.

I buy a bag for him every month and allow him 1-1.5 strips a day.  He hears the package crumple and comes running! He has separation anxiety and this is the only thing he will eat if he suspects we are leaving. If he knows I'm holding he will not let me out of his sight. He has a great nose, so I like to hide them in various places and he loves the hunt. Have tried numerous other treats - Mellow Mutt and Happy Hips jerky is the brand he goes crazy for
Go to Bell Plantation's web site and get a 4 pack for the same price.  I made the mistake of not shopping around...  You can get this for a much better price.

it's hard to say how much i love this stuff. i've tried many brands, but this is it for me. others tend to taste a bit green and weedy, whereas this brand is sweeter and mild. i could see bringing this with me on a ride on my road bike. best when cold, of course.

I have grown up on Open Pit.  It seems to be the only sauce that my parents have used, and the only on that I truly enjoy.  It is sort of spicy, yet tomatoey (is that a word).  A lot of stores have stopped carrying it on the East coast, but we have found it through Amazon.
It is what it is. Our community now has erected a poop station The bags are actually bigger and stronger

This is big! It's about a foot long and they has a pretty good girth to it (that's what she said)! It's not as soft as normal jerky you find in the bag - I think this stuff is made differently. It's tough and salty (that's what she said). It's not the best tasting Jerky I've ever had, but for the price it definitely exceeds my expectations. I've tried the Oberto brand jerky sticks and they were not very good at all. And with 23g of protein and only 2g of fat in each stick it's pretty good for you! One stick is pretty much a meal, though. I find myself working on it for about 30 minutes before I down it all (that's what she said).

Goodnight everybody - i'll be in town all week!
We use this popcorn in an air popper on the weekends. It is delicious and tastes much better than anything we have been able to find in the stores.
My dogs like this so much that they bark while I'm dishing it up!  They have liked all of the Wellness Stew brands that they have tried.  It smells and looks good too.

I have been eating TAFFY cookies since I was a little girl. Raised in CA they were always available 2 me... When i moved 2 the east coast in my twenties i couldn't find them here. I use to buy boxes when i went 2 visit friends down south lol. When mothers went out of business i thought i would have 2 give up cookies all together thats how good they are!!! im so glad they are back... now i just need to get them 2 the east coast!!!!!

Summary: surprisingly neutral flavor with no aftertaste, but perhaps less sweet than some sugar substitutes
Text:
As some background, I should disclose that I regularly use Splenda -- most frequently in plain greek yogurt, either mixed in with some fruit or some other flavoring such as vanilla beans. In the past I have regularly used Nutrasweet. I have tried Stevia but I found that I did not like its aftertaste. I never warmed to saccharine because of its bad aftertaste, too. I have used Splenda blends in baking with good results as well, though I seldom bake any sweets any more due to dietary reasons.

What I liked about Nectresse was that it didn't seem to add any flavor to my yogurt beyond sweetness. I detected no aftertaste at all, and the sweetness itself was fairly mild. By comparison, the same amount of Splenda (one packet per 8 ounces of yogurt) has a higher level of sweetness.

Just to confirm my perceptions, I decided to taste both Nectresse and Splenda by themselves. In this taste test, I again found Nectresse to have a slightly lower level of sweetness. Nectresse looks a bit more like sugar -- small grains versus fine white powder. Beyond the different appearance and slightly different intensity level, the products were nearly identical in that they both taste clean with a hint of an aftertaste that is apparent when consumed alone but is masked when used as they normally would be -- mixed with other ingredients.

I'll leave it to others to debate how natural this product is. In addition to the hyped monk fruit extract, it also contains erythritol, sugar, and molasses. In fact, erythritol is the first ingredient listed, so I assume that means that the product, by weight, contains more of that than the other ingredients. According to what I read online, erythritol is much less likely to cause intestinal discomfort than other sugar alcohols because it is largely absorbed in the small intestine. I've never been bothered by any sugar alcohol in this regard, however, except on the lone unfortunate occasion when I consumed WAY too much sugar-free chocolate and had a regretful afternoon.

What can I saw, is there a better (non-gourmet) coffee than Tim Horton's? If there is, please someone let me know, because to find a bag of flavorful & rich coffee for under 7$ is quite a bargain these days. If you like Dunkin Donuts, this feels like its Canadian richer relative, same fine taste but slightly more sophisticated ;)

Enjoy, Alex

A hint of brown sugar, that is. Well, I happen to like more than a hint of sweetness in my bowl of cereal, so I had to figure out how to approach this cereal. Looking at the marketing on the box, I tried to pretend I was someone who actually cared enough about their health to appreciate the lack of sweetness in their brand of cereal. When I did, this cereal immediately came across as tasty and healthy. There is a hint of brown sugar, but nothing more. Just enough to keep you from wanting to ask someone else for a packet of sugar if you were eating it at work, for example. I happen to be eating it at home, so once I tried it without sugar, I put my daily dose of sugar back in there, so I could judge the taste of the actual product both ways. I think both the health nut and the sugar-adventurous type will appreciate the taste of this cereal. My rating takes my bias in favor of sugar into account, and judges the actual product by how I would take it in my natural environment. Especially since the user can always add a sweetener later, but you can't add taste so easily.

If you're kids are already 'trained' to eat healthy, they could theoretically munch on these as a snack-in addition to having them with milk-without complaining. If you're kids are the 'frosted flakes' type, then they may glance you a 'why are you doing this to me?' look. They'll be getting their whole grains, a good amount of protein (6g/cup)and fiber (5g/cup). If you glanced a 'this is all we have, so take it or leave it' look, then I think they'd continue to munch on it, but not without giving that 'fine...but I'm not thrilled about this, just so you know' pouty-face look.

On the front, it says the cereal has 1 gram per serving of soluble fiber and that 3 grams of soluble fiber from oatmeal daily in a diet low in saturated fat and cholesterol may reduce the risk of heart disease, but in the nutritional facts section, it states the product as having 2 grams of soluble fiber (with a total fiber content of 5 grams). I guess if you were looking out for that kind of thing, you might take the lowest figure of 1 gram per serving, to be safe.

In sum, it's pretty good-tasting and healthy,too.

Summary: My Idea of a Good Diet Food.
Text:
I'm presently on a diet and I was at my Fresh and Easy Neighborhood Grocery looking over possible diet foods. I wanted things that were tasty, non-fat and low in calories. I came home with about a dozen items. That's how I discovered the Tillen Farms Pickled Crispy Asparagus. Well, I've always liked asparagus anyway and I've enjoyed several brands of pickled asparagus. This Tillen Farms brand is really, really good! It's the best I can recall. There's an excellent flavor and a big clove of garlic down in the bottom of the jar which I'm looking forward to eating. I can't believe how good this asparagus tastes and right on the front it says "only 60 calories per jar!" Now this is my idea of a good diet food!

Gary Peterson
I Decided to fasten it under our cabinet to save more space. It is very sturdy, well made, and works great,

Summary: Beagle loves it but it stinks!
Text:
Got this for my 9 year old beagle. She "expects" treats anytime she comes back in from outside and has pretty much figured out how to work that system with my 4 year old so she gets treats every 5 minutes (really need to figure out a better lock for the back door!). I saw this Lickety Stik and the concept seems good. I had read some reviews about certain dogs not liking this product at all but that is not the case with my beagle. In fact, she LOVES this stuff and will sit near the counter staring up at it. My only issue with this product is that it really stinks....and I mean really stinks!! I try to quickly open it, let my beagle take a few licks and then close it as quickly as possible.

It works very similar to how a roll on deoderant would work so if you haven;t used it for a few days, it may take some manual intervention to get the top of the ball wet enough to turn on its own. I don't have any issues as my dog can easily get it started using her tounge.

I will most likely try the other flavors of this since my dog likes it so much. Plus, assuming this product is accurate in its description, cutting back on the fatty treats she normally gets will be a benefit to her health.
I wouldn't say my twins are picky eater, but they wouldn't eat this one.  They eat just about every Gerber's organics.

Summary: Must have been a contaminated batch
Text:
We bought a case of 12 12 oz cans back in April. Just now opened the first can. Wow. Consistency of vomit, grayish tinge, and a vile odor. Opened a second can -- exactly the same. No way were we going to feed it to our dog. Something was clearly wrong.

We've been buying Newman's Own dog food for the last two years (since we got a dog) and never experienced anything like this. Interesting to look back at the reviews here and see three from the April - May timeframe that sound like there may have been similar issues for others around the same time we made our purchase. Guessing there must have been a production run that resulted in contaminated product. We've reported the issue to both Newman's Own and the FDA.

Candy is sugar-free but has a good taste with no after taste. Flavoris creamy with nice chocolate mint flavor.
Candy was well packaged and cheaper than at most retail stores.

Summary: good for skin, good for heart
Text: I absolutely love this deal. Got 4-pack and store it in my fridge. I use 2 table spoons every day - just adding to my shakes in the morning. It works wonders! My skin has improved and my heart rate is better.

My children have been on a gluten free diet for 6 years now. They love this bread! It is great for lunches - we put it in a sandwhich holder so the bread doesn't crumble. Highly recommend it to anyone on a gluten free diet.

Though I could cheap it up on cat food. I thought wrong. This food cost me two trips to the vet due to intestinal issues it caused. Stick with a more expensive Vet-recommended product. It will save you in the long run.

I grew up on iced tea. Unfortunately, being a Yankee, it was Nestea instant mix. After moving down south, I discovered what REAL ice tea is. Over the years, making iced tea at home, I had tried the big-name teas - Lipton, Luzianne, Tetley, etc. - and thought they were okay, but I could never quite make the tea strong enough no matter how long I left the teabags to steep. Then I came across Red Rose at the grocery store one day and thought I'd give it a try. Wow, was I blown away at how much better it was. Huge tea flavor from the same amount of teabags - that astringent tannin taste was so much more that I now think other brands must somehow either use poorer quality tea leaves or screw something up in their processing.

But then, wouldn't you know, my grocery store stopped carrying Red Rose tea, so I started ordering it online directly from the company a few years ago. I have had only one issue with one box (it had 21 instead of 22 and I just wanted to let them know for q.a. purposes - no big deal) and they promptly sent me a whole new box. That's real customer service! A company that cares if you like them or not, even if the issue was such a trifle! Finally, I found you can order it here at Amazon, albeit by the case, but that saves on shipping costs vs. ordering thru Redco Foods directly (where you can order individual boxes if you want to try it out). And at $3/box it is a terrific price and value for the superior quality received.

So, if you would like a stronger tea flavor from your ice tea, then Red Rose is the brand you've been looking for.

These cookies are delicious and gluten-free. I bought them as a gift for my daughter who has Celiac disease. But I eat them, too, just because of the taste and texture! The sale price was great, and they are wrapped individually for convenience. Great for packing lunches or just a snack on the go!

Summary: Worst of the Hormel Compleats I have tried.
Text: I have tried most of the Hormel completes, and tend to like most of them. The meatloaf though has no flavor, it tastes like no meatloaf I have ever eaten, it is worse than bland,it has a bad taste.

We picked up a box at their store in Waterbury, VT and it is one of my favorite K cups. The price was right, $16 for a pack of 24. It is great on a cold morning, perfectly balanced, not bitter, light and crisp!

Summary: Except for the directions, this product does not let down
Text:
The directions tell you to only use these beans for your coffee. That's not necessary. I, myself, use regular beans and just a single teaspoon of Folgers on top and the end result is unbelievable.
I also recommend you keep your open bag in the refrigerator and the closed ones in your freezer, in order to keep them fresh.

As a gluten sensitive individual, I have found Bob's Redmill gluten free oatmeal allows me to use oatmeal in many recipies and just as a
cereal that was off limits to me before. It's a very good product.

This was an Amazon verified purchase.

Summary: Mrs. May's Dry-Roasted Snack, Cashew Crunch
Text: The Cashew Crunch is a very tasty snack.  The flavor of the cashews is not destroyed with a lot of other ingredients.  I love that they are all natural with no artificial colors or flavors.

I generally make my own shakes from Whey Protein powder and add either yogurt (Yoplait vanilla is a favorite) or bananas, then blend it with a hand blender. The pre-mixed protein shakes I have tried are generally not as good. After trying this recovery shake though, containing both casein and whey proteins, I would have to say that it was actually pretty good. It was a little high in carbs (44gr) but I've never been one to worry about those.
A good protein shake overall.
Our middle school students were delighted when they received Zotz at school.  Zotz are fun and tradeable.

Summary: Surprisingly tasty, crunchy, not too sweet
Text: As a lover of more hearty cereals like Grape-Nuts, I was a little worried this one might be too sweet.  Instead, I was pleasantly surprised to find that, sure, it reminded me (a lot) of Frosted Flakes, but was better.  It stayed very crunchy in milk (can't say that about the Frosted Flakes I remember), had a nice nuttiness to it - although I can't say I'd necessarily have realized it had nuts if the package hadn't clued me in.  As for healthiness - it's fortified like most cereals these days, but I was definitely hungry again an hour later and wasn't impressed by the protein or fiber content.  Overall a good cereal, but I docked one star for its dubious health value - I'll probably go back to Grape Nuts for daily eating.

Summary: 72 oz for $17 is a bargain not if want quality
Text: Sure this is cheap but its Tuna flakes and some water. I'd say about 9 oz Tuna and 3 oz water. I didnt like the texture and taste that much. I prefer the more solid meat less/no water ones that are more costly like Wild Planet and Chicken of the Sea brands. They dont make the surroundings stinky at all, but this Ambrosia  is a stink disaster waiting to happen. I also found it more smelly and i have to store half if it for later use. All too messy for me
I really like this coconut oil.  It's great for cooking.  It's also great for skin and (if necessary) haircare. There are so many uses for coconut oil that it is a staple item in my home!

Lucks Edible Image Deer, 1 ea
The image was exactly what I expected down to the very detail. So easy to use and to put on the top of the cake. I trimmed in brown, added the deer footprints around it and it looked like a professional. I am sure that my brother is going to love his birthday cake as he is a avid whitetail hunter. Lucks did a wonderful job and they go out of their way to meet your needs and made sure that I had my image in time for the weekend. A very big thank you to Lucks.

These raisins are are larger, plumper and moister than most other raisins. They stay fresh and moist even after they have been opened for several days. These are much better than the "usual" Sunmaid raisins and are a good value when compared to other brands of deluxe raisins. I would definitely buy again.

these bars are very filling and very tasty!  I originally found them at Marshalls and was thrilled to find them in bulk here on amazon.com.  They're great for on the go days, and they really are filling.

I took this shampoo (and the conditioner) to the beauty salon with me.  The products meet the approval of my stylist and the owner of the salon. The shampoo was pleasant smelling, and left my hair soft. I also noted that it was quite easy to wash out. In the days since my wash, I haven't seen any flakes, or experienced anu itching.

Summary: They are ok but "brand" is deceptive
Text: I am not sure these are that different than any generic root beer barrels you might buy.  They taste fine, have a nice flavor and are as good as the rest.  But don't fool yourself into thinking these are "original" or made by Dad's.  Probably the exact same maker of the generic root beer barrels has licensed the Dad's name and puts a label on these -- and they cost 25-50% more than the others.

Summary: Great Option for a Healthy Snack!
Text: I have never had sardines before, and wasn't sure what to expect. I was pleasantly surprised by these. The sardines are firm and meaty, the flavor is great and the olive oil helps keep them moist and easy to swallow. Highly recommend!

MIO's concept is quite cool. Basically, these are small 1.6-ouce squirt bottles which you can store pretty much anywhere - a cabinet, a desk drawer, a backpack, etc. - and you squirt them into water to create a flavored drink. In this case, it's "peach tea" flavored and you put in one squirt for every 8 ounces of water. It's extremely convenient to just grab a bottle of water, throw two squirts of this stuff in, shake it up, and enjoy.

But more importantly, does it taste good? Well... it taste OK. Nobody would mistake it for fresh Peach Tea, but it is somewhat palatable. I didn't notice the "chemical" aftertaste that other reviewers have mentioned, but it definitely does come across as artificially flavored. Based on other reviewers comments, it seems like there is wide range of opinions on the taste (as you would probably expect). So if you're looking for a convenient way to have flavored water anytime, then it's probably worth at least trying this product.
These are great for small dogs or for training. All good stuff in them too.

My husband loves the coffee, but this is the only one he's had that he has to continually clean out the machine because the cartridges don't remained sealed. The coffee grounds get inside the machine and in the coffee. After closer inspection, some of the cups aren't well sealed when they come out of the box. The price sounded good, but not for the quality and aggrevation. We will not purchase Van Houtte products in the future.

Summary: Glass bottles are much better than plastic.
Text: I have recently gotten into the sugar free syrups for my afternoon coffee break. The DaVinci syrups are very good in taste and quality. I will continue to purchase them but I prefer the glass bottles as opposed to the plastic packaging. To me, they taste better. In fact, if they come to me in plastic bottles, I will send them back. Similarly, if I find them in a store, I will not buy the ones in plastic bottles.

I bought this because I was looking for something with probiotics.  I have purchased a similar product from Plum Organics (contained Pro and prebiotics).  I have purchased several items from HappyBellies before and have been pleased with them all.  I ordered this despite the reviews from others that commented on the rancid smell.  I assume this has to do with the added DHA.  I bought 6 containers.  Opened all 6 and they ALL smelled rancid.  I would never feed this to my child.  Ended up contacting Amazon because there was no return available for this product.  Save yourself the hassle.  Buy Plum Organics Multi grain cereal.

I purchased the Senseo Dark Roast coffee pods for two important reasons.
First, the ease of use and second I REALLY enjoy the flavor of a freshly brewed
cup every time I want one.

My son is on the GFCG diet and these are his favorite snack. Although one shipment the pretzels were all broken in pieces. But usually they are great.

Support Autism Awareness

I really like this Superfood, but this is the only amazing grass product I have tried. If it doesn't dissolve really well, it can be a bit sweet. I've discovered that it dissolves really well in soy milk, but not almond or coconut milk. I also love the way it makes me feel. I'm gonna try some more of the flavors.

Also, this is one of the amazing grass products that is not organic. Most are; this one isn't.

This product is amazing. It works great, smells great, is all organic and is about 4x cheaper than any other enzyme peel on the market (because it is half the price and twice the size). You can also get it almost anywhere. It made a huge difference on my skin and I would recommend it to anyone who has acne or a dull, bumpy complexion. The one down side is that it stings quite a bit, but it's supposed to do that. And afterward it feels great.
This is the second time I ordered this coffee.  Very good blend with a very smooth taste.  You can't go wrong if you like Hazelnut coffee.

Summary: Bye bye Starbucks!  This stuff is better!
Text: I am verrrry particular, and I can promise you this stuff tastes just like Starbucks' Green Tea Lattes!  I fell in love with this drink, but had a hard time accepting that I'd have to drop almost $5 every time.  I went on a mission to find an alternative, but didn't think I'd find one identical in taste.  I mixed 2 TBSP with 12 oz of soy milk and served it over ice.  The powder dissolved instantly, unlike the Starbucks stuff that just sits on the bottom and on the lid.  It's also sweetened, making it even more ridiculously easy to make.  This is probably going to be the least expensive Matcha mix you'll find, too, so look no further.  Try it!

Summary: Best in Class Dry Dog Food
Text:
Pet food has an immense range of quality that you can very roughly categorize into three levels. (1) super cheap food that's basically feeding your dog garbage (1-2 stars); (2) food that's a good compromise on price and quality, containing some ingredients that aren't ideal but overall a healthy product (3-4 stars); and (3) "price is no object" foods that make no compromises (5-6 stars). Orijen doesn't just fall into category 3, it's the best of it. It's expensive, but you will not find a better dog food anywhere. Period.

Orijen is a Canada-based company that raises its own chickens, employs its own fisherman to catch fish and deliver them fresh, uses whole eggs instead of dried egg products, and loads its products with the highest quality ingredients you'll ever find in dog food. It's good for your dog's muscles, heart, coat, skin, and is the most biologically appropriate dry dog food there is. Instead of grains for the carb content that it needs to form the kibble, Orijen uses highly digestible fruits and vegetables with nutritious antioxidants and vitamins.

Check out the first 6 ingredients in this product: Fresh deboned chicken, chicken meal, turkey meal, russet potato, fresh deboned pacific salmon (a natural source of DHA and EPA), herring meal. Meat, meat, meat, good carbs, meat, meat.

Compare that to the first 6 ingredients in Hill's Science Diet Adult Small Bites Dry Dog Food, which I just selected by picking the first large size that came up in a search for "hill's science diet dry dog food." Chicken, ground whole grain corn, ground whole grain sorghum, ground whole grain wheat, chicken by-product meal, soybean meal. Meat, grain, grain, grain, low-quality animal filler like beaks and feet, and more grain. It's loaded with grains that are cheap and known to be difficult to digest, often the cause of allergic reactions in dogs, and not nutritious.

If you want a good compromise product, go for something like Chicken Soup for the Dog Lover's Soul Dry Dog Food for Adult Dog, Chicken Flavor, 35 Pound Bag, a very good food that's a bit more affordable than Orijen. If you want the best of the best for your fuzzy-faced friend(s), get Orijen.

Final note: this is extremely rich food. Introduce it very slowly, even more slowly than you normally would a new food, and expect some loose stools during the process. We started with 1/6 new food and upped it by 1/6 every week, so we took a month a half to transition completely to Orijen. That helped a lot.

It seemed like a good idea. Buy in bulk and save some cash, but as it were being shipped it must have warmed up and cooled down. Many of them were stuck together, and colors rubbed off on each other. There was a 2lb mass of beans in the box! Also, beware and don't freak out because the package consists of a cardboard box and jelly beans. No plastic inside the box, no paper lining, nothing. Kind of creepy, but I'm not dead yet, so it must be okay.

This popcorn has a good taste like the movies theaters at a reasonable price. The package contains all of the ingredients and instructions to a good eating and popping experience.
Although I didn't got through the whole case I bought,family and friends loved it. Nice product I'll buy from Discount Tommy soon!

Marcla

I am not a chocolate connoisseur, but I've tasted enough varieties to know some of the differences. I like dark chocolate but still prefer it to retain some sweetness, which can be a tricky balance. (Ever try 95% dark cocoa chocolate? It's like paying $5 to eat a stick of chalk.)

This chocolate bar is labeled as 54% cocoa, which is an interesting choice. It has a nice aroma, and the color is somewhere between milk chocolate and one of those European dark chocolate bars. Most importantly, it tastes great. There is a smooth consistency, and it has a really nice blend of sweetness and bitterness. I shared the bar with a couple of other folks, who had the same impression. We give it 3 thumbs up.
We tried over and over to catch the moles and no luck. So I would not recommend this product for getting the moles out of your yard.

This is one of my favorite Amy's "canned" products.  It's flavor is unique and comforting. If you love the taste, smell, and spiciness of Indian curry, you gotta give this a try.  It's delectable and memorable!

I bought this product on September 2010 and this product expires on the 27th of August 2010. I have bought alot of products with amazon and until now I had no problems. I dont understand why Amazon would send me a product that would expire two months after I received it.

Got a shelter dog back in November... Bichon Frise. We have been thru 7 different brands of food and also boiling chicken and rice for him as well. His digestive system is a mess, and recently we learned his pancreas numbers were off as well. This is why we decided to go low fat.

It has been 12 days and the improvement is remarkable. We finally have good poop. It's a miracle! PLUS he liked it right away as well.

I researched dozens of dog foods over the last 6 months, and recently at least 6 low fat dry foods. This one appeared to be the best, and it is definitely the best for our dog! We are VERY HAPPY with our choice. Plus it magically comes to the door via UPS.

I was a bit cautious when I first opened the box. I need gluten free and sugar free products with low carbs. This candy fit the bill. The texture is a bit strange but,Wow the candy is tasty and lasts a long time. I bought the ginger, licorice  and raspberry flavor.

Summary: Little Bit ogf Tea and Caffeine and Great peach flavor
Text: Love this stuff. Has just a bit of Cafeeine and Green tea and a great peach flavor. The perfect refreshment.

I'm a vegan and I just love this peanut butter! Justin's nut butter is so delicious I can't go a day without having the peanut butter on my apple or bread or just even taking a squeeze pack to go! I recommend every vegan out there to try some of Justin's nut butter!

Summary: A taste of heaven in a bottle
Text:
Based on a recommendation, I purchased an order of Claude's Brisket Marinade through Amazon and tried it on a brisket. This is a cut of beef I've never used before, but after tasting the mouthwatering deliciousness of this cut and Claude's, I am hooked. Last week I bought a second brisket and cooked it with the same amazing results. The recipe is on the bottle, however, there's a more in-depth recipe on the Claude's website, plus a brisket salad recipe and others.

While the recipe suggests a roasting temperature of 300 degrees, I chose to cook the meat in a 225 degree oven--8 hours for a four pound brisket. I used a Le Creuset roasting pan with a layer of foil placed between the pan and the cover. No juices cooked away and the result was a fork-tender cut of meat.

Honestly, this is the best marinade I've ever tasted.

Summary: Great unsweetened cocoa powder that doesn't make you break out
Text:
I've been using this cocoa powder very regularly for about 4 weeks now (I mix it with a denatured whey that I drink in the mornings), and I really, really like it.

First of all, it adds a great chocolate taste to my whey drink.

And secondly (and of equal import!), it doesn't make me break out.

All other chocolate that I consume makes me break out, so, of course, I can't eat/drink it very often.

Thanks heavens this isn't true about this Nestle Toll House Cocoa.

I can only hypothesize as to why this is true, and have two possible reasons:

1. It isn't Dutch-processed (hasn't been alkalized); or
2. It's a purer form of chocolate that doesn't have some of the additives that
are often added to chocolate.

Regardless of whether either of the above hypotheses are true, it simply doesn't make me break out (hooray!!!)!!

Summary: An energy drink without caffeine? Excellent concept!
Text: I did not realize that there was an energy drink made without caffeine until I stumbled upon this product in Amazon. What an excellent concept! For those who have a difficult time consuming caffeine because it makes you jittery but still need a little extra boost to get your through the day, then you definitely need to try RevHoney Berry Rain. The concept behind the energy boost is that RevHoney is made from real honey so the honey blend mix in the beverage provides the added energy kick. This is an excellent product that actually tastes really good too. I now drink RevHoney not only for the energy boost but as a substitute for a cola as well because it is a healthy drink so it is better for you than the cola drinks. I would definitely recommend this product!

Summary: I don't know what all the fuss is about.
Text: These are ok. The best way to describe the taste is that they taste exactly like pepsi cola that's gone flat. They're not terrible but they also aren't that great.
One bite was enough the package went in the trash. Used to buy these in England family favorite this product tasted old

Summary: Garden of Good Eating soy corn chips
Text: I love these chips.  Nice alternative to the regular.  Small size, but sturdy enough for the thickest bean dip. Travel well with minimal breakage in bag.

The chocolate and coconut flavor is so good. You feel like you are eating something really bad, but you're not. Only 120 calories per bar, 4 grams of fiber, no corn syrup or artificial ingredients. I was under the impression that these would be chewy granola bars because the box says "tasty little chewies" on the front but the granola layer is more on the hard/crunchy side. I think it would be better if it was a more chewy bar. I absolutely love the taste though and that's why I'm giving it 5 stars instead of 4 because of the hardness of the granola.

Re:Four Cheese sauce had a little recipe on the box, so I tried it........and loved it, Mmm good.
Add some Italian sausage and sweet peppers, onions, and I was in Heaven.
I do a lot of cooking (supervising) and this was just outstanding.

Bought as a gift for my mother, who recently started drinking coffee again and uses the K-cups.  I bought the chrome because it matched her kitchen.  It does as it is intended to do.  Shiny, attractive, holds enough K-cups that I was able to get rid of the boxes the multi-packs come in, and turns easily.  It also fits in a standard size kitchen cabinet when she needs the counter space.  She has nothing but positive things to say about it.  I just bought a second one for my daughter.
I love Jason's Deli fruit dip, and used this item to make an imitation of it.  It works great.  Would buy it again.

I am so excited to find these on Amazon, for a decent price and with free shipping for Amazon Prime members.  These are made in Austria.  They come in several flavors, but hazelnut is a traditional European, particularly German/Austrian flavor.  It is used in a lot of dishes.  These are yummy.  My Austrian mom used to buy these for my sister and I when we were kids.  When my kids and I were in Austria 6 years ago and in Germany 2 years ago we devoured these whenever we could find them.  Now we can get them any time on Amazon.  I think I will buy them around the holidays!  I recommend these.  They are traditional, authentic and delicious!

I have been a fan of rooibos for several years now. This is my favorite blend. Never cloying or sweet. It's more an 'essence' of vanilla -- not at all an artificial taste.  This red tea is rich in antioxidants.  Very smooth and drinkable with no bitterness. Each bag is wrapped in its own sealed fresh pack.  Perfect for travel.  Organic, so there are no chemicals to worry about. I love it!!!

These almond flavor by this company brand is simply the best by far.  Great flavor that has the essence of true BBQ taste that is not too spicy.  A great snack whenever and wherever,  you may not be able to eat just one.  to tell the truth,  you might find yourself telling people to keep there hands off your nuts.  yummy!

Summary: mint or cookie dough flavors = amazing
Text: I have read some of the reviews on here and yeah the chocolate peanut butter and the chocolate are kind of weird and sort of taste like a frozen protein shake. The vanilla maple and the strawberry banana flavors are watery in a sorbet kind of way but still very delicious. The mint and cookie dough flavors, however, are AMAZING. Totally rich and creamy and delicious. So give those flavors a try before you make your judgment!

Williamson, previously Williamson & Magor, make a rich, well blended Earl Grey with a deep delicate spicy flavor that is without equal. I used to think that Harrod's No. 42 Earl Grey was the best I had tasted. It is, however, unavailable in the US, and must be purchased in Britain. Some Internet research uncovered that it is blended for Harrod's by Williamson, so I tracked down their Earl Grey which was then avaliable on two US websites. It is even better than Harrod's. Harrod's Earl Grey, by the way, is best purchased as you leave the UK. There is a Harrod's store in the international departure area at Heathrow - they do not charge the 18% VAT. Willaimson reorganized last year and their tea was supposedly unavailable in the US, so its appearance on Amazon - and with Amazon Prime elegibility - is more than welcome. This is the finest.
Another fact: Williamson is reputed to blend the tea for the Royal Family in Britain.
Some added thoughts: I did a little research on the Williamson website. They now grow their tea on their own farms in the hioghlands of Kenya. Undoubtedly the superior flavor of the tea comes from the quality of the base tea. They mention picking only the bud and first two leaves. That cannot be beat. Some teas are the first three; Argentine tea (known for being some ofthe world's worst) is "harvested" with a machine that looks like a hedge trimmer. Any leaves past the first three have no tea flavor. So excellent harvesting is a laborious hand process.

I drink a lot of coffee.  I like it black and medium to full bodied.  I like french roast and Sumatra but not in the morning. In the morning I like something lighter but not weak. This is the best morning K-cup I have tried.  It is full bodied and flavorful. It has a slightly nutty flavor and is in the true tradition of single origin South American.  I wish they had a Guatemalan but this is the next best thing. My only complaint is they stopped offering it as a subscribe and save.

I like this herbal tea. It contains a pleasing blend of blackberry and vanilla flavors that team up to make a soothing, delicious beverage. The pyramidal shape of the tea bag is a nice innovation -- it allows the hot water to mingle more freely with the herbs inside. I can't prove that this creates a better cup of herbal tea, but it certainly can't hurt. The box that the tea bags come in is designed to provide a pretty good seal when it is closed. This should help keep the contents fresh for some time.

I have purchased and thrown away countless edible writers because they simply don't work. I ordered these and have been shocked at how well they write. They have a smooth tip, somewhat like a sharpie marker. I drew faces on 30 cake pops and never encountered a problem. I LOVE this product.

Summary: Buy these as soon as they are available
Text: These buns ROCK! I was lucky to pick them up at an Udi's cafe in Denver. They are just as delicious and 'real' tasing as the gluten-free bread. They also double as sub sandwich bread. Definitely a game changer for gluten free foods. Udi's definitely does it right.

After buying this product today at Costco (for less than $7), I had heated some up with milk in the microwave. I found it delicious and much easier to chew than hard granola.  It is so good for us, to eat these ancient grains!  I will probably eat this for a snack, too.  As Martha says, It is a good thing.

Really excellent tea, flowers are visible in the bag so I know it's the real thing.  The tin is beautiful! My husband loves chamomile tea before bed, and this is a good one.  Will definitely buy again.

Tears ago "Korr" made a Newburg Sauce in a bag, Add milk and butter, heat and use. Loved it over shrimp scampi and rice, and it was readily available in the grocery sore. Since I can no longer find it, I was lucky and ran across The Bar Harbor product which I absolutely love. Thanks

Summary: Excellent service. Glad to do business with! Thanks :-)
Text: Arrived quickly. It was in excellent condition. What you see on the internet looks like what you get in your package. Excellent service. Glad to do business with! Thanks :-)
better than grahm crakers and they do not spike your blood sugar (at least not mine.)
Great hot and iced, pleasant taste. Highly recommend. I've been purchasing Peach Detox for about 5 mths. now.  Thanks Amazon for fair pricing and having available.
Maybe, I got a bad one.  It's very plain, nothing special in flavor.  I felt like I wasted my time and money. I will not buy this flavor again.
Order arrived quickly, earlier than stated -  coffee is great and makes a great iced coffee... I will order these again.

Summary: As good as the pasta in the lt. blue box with yellow writting
Text: After tasting several gluten free pastas over the course of four years, this is the best.  Also, it doesn't get mushy at all, even after reheating, it stays al dente.

Our dog has wheat, corn and soy allergies, so I was excited to see the option w/o these.  Unfortunately, she was not the least bit interested in trying the treat -- and this is a dog who eats everything!
